name: NLQ Query App
content:
NLQ App

Automated analysis of Verizon lease agreements for optimal contract renewals


Project Overview


Objective:

The NLQ Application is a powerful tool that allows users to interact with database tables using natural language queries. Instead of writing complex SQL commands, users can simply type their questions in plain English, and the application will retrieve the desired data from the database. This tool is ideal for analysts, developers, and non-technical users who need quick insights from their data.


Key Features

Natural Language Query Processing

  • Users can ask questions in plain English (e.g., "What are the total sales for last month?" or "Show me the top 10 customers by revenue").
  • The application automatically converts queries into SQL commands to fetch results.


Database Integration

  • Supports integration with various databases, including MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQLite, and SQL Server.
  • Connect to one or multiple tables for querying.


Query Refinement

  • Provides suggestions for refining queries if the input is ambiguous.
  • Offers options to clarify column names, table relationships, or filters.

Customizable Query Templates

  • Save frequently used queries for future use.
  • Create and manage predefined query templates for common tasks.

Visualization Options

  • View results in tabular format or visualize them as charts (e.g., bar, line, pie).
  • Export results to CSV or Excel for offline analysis.

User-Friendly Interface

  • Easy-to-use input field for natural language queries.
  • Intuitive dashboard to manage database connections and query history.


How It Works

Connect to a Database

  • Configure the application by providing the database connection details (host, port, username, password, database name).
  • Test the connection to ensure it is working correctly.

Input Your Query

  • Type your question in the query box.
  • Examples of valid questions:
  • "What is the average salary in the Employees table?"
  • "List all orders placed in the last 30 days."
  • "How many customers are from New York?"format.

Refine Queries if Needed

  • If the query result is not as expected, use the suggested refinements to adjust filters or clarify ambiguities.


Use Cases:

  • Business Analysis: Quickly generate reports and insights from sales, customer, or operational data.
  • Data Exploration: Explore and analyze data without needing SQL expertise.
  • Ad Hoc Queries: Answer specific business questions on the fly.
  • Team Collaboration: Enable non-technical team members to interact with database data directly.


View and Export Results:

  • The application processes the query and retrieves data from the connected database.
  • \View the results directly in the interface or export them to your preferred
